usertrack --enable-unique-id --enable-ssl --with-ssl=/usr/local/ssl --enable-
http --enable-cgi --enable-cgid --enable-spelling --enable-auth-ldap --enable-

creator: alcol@hotmail.com
alcol@hotmail.com
text:
This is the LDAP C SDK used from me! Have I to use a more old release or what?

ldapcsdk5.08-Linux2.2_x86_glibc_PTH_OPT.OBJ.tar.gz

creator: bnicholes@apache.org
text:
This is happening because configure in Apache 2.0.x does not correctly detect 
the LDAP SDK.  It just assumes OpenLDAP.  This has been fixed in Apache 
2.1/2.2.  For Apache 2.0 you will need to tweak apr-util/include/apr_ldap.h 
yourself to get the right set of #define's for the iPlanet LDAP SDK.

creator: alcol@hotmail.com
text:
for what I know the last release of HTTPD project is 2.0.54 and is 2.1.3 BETA 
(not RELEASED) but never seen even in DOCs v2.2.

Over to be able to find 2.1 or 2.2, is smart to use them instead of last final 
2.0.54?

please for httpd 2.0.54 let me to know the best way so to trick the apr_ldap.h 
file what to comment and what to reigger as boolean to 1 or what else.
creator: alcol@hotmail.com
alcol@hotmail.com
text:
HTTPD 2.0.54, in include/apr_ldap.h I tried to do:

#else /* APR_NOT_READY_YET */

/* FIXME: remove this when above code works.  Default to build with
 * OpenLDAP until apu-conf.m4 support exists */
#define APR_HAS_OPENLDAP_LDAPSDK 0
define APR_HAS_NETSCAPE_LDAPSDK 1
#define APR_HAS_NETSCAPE_LDAPSDK 1
#define APR_HAS_LDAP_SSL 1
define APR_HAS_LDAP_SSL 1

but I got:

creator: alcol@hotmail.com
text: httpd v2.1.3 BETA seems to compile cleanly with iPlanet 5.08 OPT x Linux

(In reply to comment #7)
> HTTPD 2.0.54, in include/apr_ldap.h I tried to do:
> 
> #else /* APR_NOT_READY_YET */
> 
> /* FIXME: remove this when above code works.  Default to build with
>  * OpenLDAP until apu-conf.m4 support exists */
> #define APR_HAS_OPENLDAP_LDAPSDK 0
> define APR_HAS_NETSCAPE_LDAPSDK 1
> #define APR_HAS_NETSCAPE_LDAPSDK 1
> #define APR_HAS_LDAP_SSL 1
> define APR_HAS_LDAP_SSL 1
> 


No no.. You don't uncomment 'defines'...  It should be:

/* FIXME: remove this when above code works.  Default to build with
 * OpenLDAP until apu-conf.m4 support exists */
#define APR_HAS_OPENLDAP_LDAPSDK 0
#define APR_HAS_NETSCAPE_LDAPSDK 1
#define APR_HAS_LDAP_SSL 1

It now compiles, but I get:

Syntax error on line 188 of /usr/local/apache2/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /usr/local/apache2/modules/mod_ldap.so into server: /usr/local/apach
e2/modules/mod_ldap.so: undefined symbol: ldapssl_init
creator: stella@rider.edu

text:
usually if a statement inside the conf file return an error is due to :

a) is misstyped
b) the module is not loaded

Maybe I'm wrong but if could help
creator: alcol@hotmail.com
nitinm@cadence.com
text:
We have had the similar problem. This error is usually generated util_ldap.c.
The problem is, by default, none LDAP supports SSL/TLS. I tried configuring with
--disable-ssl option but no help. Finally the workaround I found was in
modules/experimental/util_ldap.c. Bellow is the diff between the original and
modified version of util_ldap.c:

283,284c283,284
<                     /*int SSLmode = LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_HARD;
<                     result = ldap_set_option(ldc->ldap, LDAP_OPT_X_TLS,
&SSLmode);*/
---
>                     int SSLmode = LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_HARD;
>                     result = ldap_set_option(ldc->ldap, LDAP_OPT_X_TLS, &SSLmode);
1566c1566
<             /*if (st->cert_file_type == LDAP_CA_TYPE_BASE64)
---
>             if (st->cert_file_type == LDAP_CA_TYPE_BASE64)
1576c1576
<             }*/
---
>             }


Check this out and it may help. The ldap authentication is working fine for me
on Solaris 9 and apache 2.0.54. But somehow, if you are using SSL based auth
mechanism, you may need to re-compile your ldap SDK with ssl option (And
supporting libraries)

Cheers,

Nitin

creator: minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
Would it be possible to check whether this problem still exists in httpd v2.2.x
and reopen if so?
